Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model

Class ModelRepresentation

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.ModelRepresentation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ModelRepresentation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
an instance of this class is a picture of the model it's used as a container of all the information required by the view to graphically represents the game
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ModelRepresentation

      public ModelRepresentation​(Board instance, java.util.List<Player> players, int[][] selectedCells)
      Creates the representation of the model
      Parameters:
      instance - board instance
      players - list of Players in the game
      selectedCells - cells which have to be highlighted client-side (where the user can move/build)

  • Method Details

    • getWorkerPosition

      public int[][] getWorkerPosition()
      Returns:
      a matrix of int every worker is identified with the number of the player(0,1,2) and the coordinates in the matrix are the coordinates of the box where the worker is positioned.

    • getTowerPosition

      public int[][] getTowerPosition()
      Returns:
      a matrix of int every element of the matrix is the equivalent of a box for every tower is saved the height of the tower so the possible values are 0:ground 1:Level 1 2:level 2 3:Level 3 4:Dome

    • getGodList

      public java.lang.String[] getGodList()
      Returns:
      an array of strings that contains the names of the gods selected for the game the position of the god in the array defines the ownership of the god so the god in godList[0] is owned by the player 0 and so on. in the first phase of the game this array will be empty and it will be filled run time when the player selects his god

    • getPlayersName

      public java.lang.String[] getPlayersName()
      Returns:
      an array containing the players names as the others arrays the position in the array defines the ownership

    • getPlayerNum

      public int getPlayerNum()
      Returns:
      the number of players in the current game it will be 2 or 3

    • getActivePlayer

      public int getActivePlayer()
      Returns:
      the index of the current player the current player is the one who is supposed to play in the current turn

    • getActiveGodsList

      public boolean[] getActiveGodsList()
      Returns:
      an array of boolean and every boolean represents if the index player has his god active or not.

    • getLastBlock

      public java.lang.String[][] getLastBlock()
      this information can't be obtained by the tower height because Atlas can build domes at any level
      Returns:
      the last block of the tower in that box

    • getHasWon

      public boolean[] getHasWon()
      for every player we can know if she or he has won

    • getHasLost

      public boolean[] getHasLost()
      for every player we can know if she or he has lost

    • getCurrentState

      public StateEnum getCurrentState()
      Returns:
      the current state of the controller

    • getGods

      public java.util.List<GodsList> getGods()
      Returns:
      a list that contains the gods selected by the player 0 at the beginning of the game it will be used only in the first phase of the game
